description:
Speaker: Gina Häußge

Track:PyConDE
OctoPrint is an open source web interface for 3D printers and deployed world wide on a large variety of devices. In this talk I explain some of the challenges in developing and maintaining such a piece of end user facing software in Python.

Recorded at the PyConDE & PyData Berlin 2019 conference.
https://pycon.de

More details at the conference page: https://de.pycon.org/program/JQAUEC
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pydataberlin
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/pyconde
title: Driving 3D Printers with Python: Lessons Learned
